newsitem.title: DUBAI: Islamic group welcomes Russia-Chechnya deal.
newsitem.headline: Islamic group welcomes Russia-Chechnya deal.

text.p: The world's largest Moslem organisation on Monday welcomed a peace deal between Russia and Chechen rebels, saying it hoped the withdrawal of Russian troops from the separatist region would promote regional stability.

"His excellency the Secretary General of the Organisation of the Islamic Conference (OIC) Dr. Hamid Algabid welcomes the agreement reached between Russia and Chechnya," a statement issued by the Jeddah-based group said.

"The Organisation of the Islamic Conference also expresses the hope that the full withdrawal of the Russian troops from Chechnya will constitute an effective and constructive step towards stability in the region," it said.
The OIC groups more than 50 Moslem countries.
Chechen rebel leaders signed a weekend peace deal with Moscow after President Boris Yeltsin ordered a full troop withdrawal from the separatist region.
